body_html:
Good, it makes the docs more concise than my proposal.
…
On Wed, 8 Mar 2017, 23:17 gunan, ***@***.***> wrote: I have checked this again, but for me having python-virtualenv command is sufficient. You simply need to feed the -p flag, and thats it. I tested this on a clean docker image as follows: $ docker run -it ubuntu:16.04 bash $ apt-get update $ apt-get install python3 python-virtualenv $ virtualenv -p python3 tf $ source tf/bin/activate $ python3 --version Python 3.5.2 Anyway, we are updating the documentation with more stuff. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. body_text:
Good, it makes the docs more concise than my proposal.
…
On Wed, 8 Mar 2017, 23:17 gunan, ***@***.***> wrote:
 I have checked this again, but for me having python-virtualenv command is
 sufficient.
 You simply need to feed the -p flag, and thats it.
 I tested this on a clean docker image as follows:

 $ docker run -it ubuntu:16.04 bash
 $ apt-get update
 $ apt-get install python3 python-virtualenv
 $ virtualenv -p python3 tf
 $ source tf/bin/activate
 $ python3 --version
 Python 3.5.2

 Anyway, we are updating the documentation with more stuff.

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#7690 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABO3xqrbG_ckbO4MnVLJH8w-FV0jgNZaks5rjykIgaJpZM4MF7Bh>
 .
body:
Good, it makes the docs more concise than my proposal.

On Wed, 8 Mar 2017, 23:17 gunan, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I have checked this again, but for me having python-virtualenv command is
> sufficient.
> You simply need to feed the -p flag, and thats it.
> I tested this on a clean docker image as follows:
>
> $ docker run -it ubuntu:16.04 bash
> $ apt-get update
> $ apt-get install python3 python-virtualenv
> $ virtualenv -p python3 tf
> $ source tf/bin/activate
> $ python3 --version
> Python 3.5.2
>
> Anyway, we are updating the documentation with more stuff.
>
> —
